data.sentence: The word أُولَئِكَ comes from the root ا و ل ا and is associated with the meanings:

data.meanings: Proposition which points to cause, space or time. In, into, amongst, in company with, during, with, of, for, for the sake of, upon, concerning, after, in comparison, about, among, on account of, respecting, by the side of, on, by, against, according to, in respect of.
data.sentence: The word فِي comes from the root ف ي and is associated with the meanings: Proposition which points to cause, space or time. In, into, amongst, in company with, during, with, of, for, for the sake of, upon, concerning, after, in comparison, about, among, on account of, respecting, by the side of, on, by, against, according to, in respect of.

data.meanings: chastisement, castigate, punishment, torture, torment, retribution, abstain/desist, relinquish, quit.adhb - sweet (usually water), e.g. 25:53, 35:12.
data.sentence: The word الْعَذَابِ comes from the root ع ذ ب and is associated with the meanings: chastisement, castigate, punishment, torture, torment, retribution, abstain/desist, relinquish, quit.adhb - sweet (usually water), e.g. 25:53, 35:12.

data.meanings: to become behind, lack, become in the rear, lag behind (strength), become incapable, powerless, be weak. ujuzun - old women. a'jaza (vb. 4) to weaken, frustrate, find one to be weak. mu'ajiz - one who baffles. ajzun (pl. a'jazun) - portion of the trunk that is below its upper part.. . A'jaztu (prf. 1st. sing.): I am unable, became incapable.. Yu'jizuuna (imp. 3rd. m. plu. IV.): They shall be able to frustrate.. Li Yu'jiza (imp. 3rd. m. sing. el.): He can frustrate.. Nu'jiza (imp. 1st. plu.): We shall frustrate.. Mu'aajiziina (ap-der. m. plu. III.): Frustraters.. Mu'jizun (ap-der. m. sing. IV.): Frustrater.. Mu'jiziina / Mu'jizii (ap-der. m. plu. IV. final Nun is dropped.): Frustraters.. 'Ajuuzun (n.): Old woman who has passed child bearing age.. A'jaazun (n. plu.): Trunks.
data.sentence: The word مُعَاجِزِينَ comes from the root ع ج ز and is associated with the meanings: to become behind, lack, become in the rear, lag behind (strength), become incapable, powerless, be weak. ujuzun - old women. a'jaza (vb. 4) to weaken, frustrate, find one to be weak. mu'ajiz - one who baffles. ajzun (pl. a'jazun) - portion of the trunk that is below its upper part.. . A'jaztu (prf. 1st. sing.): I am unable, became incapable.. Yu'jizuuna (imp. 3rd. m. plu. IV.): They shall be able to frustrate.. Li Yu'jiza (imp. 3rd. m. sing. el.): He can frustrate.. Nu'jiza (imp. 1st. plu.): We shall frustrate.. Mu'aajiziina (ap-der. m. plu. III.): Frustraters.. Mu'jizun (ap-der. m. sing. IV.): Frustrater.. Mu'jiziina / Mu'jizii (ap-der. m. plu. IV. final Nun is dropped.): Frustraters.. 'Ajuuzun (n.): Old woman who has passed child bearing age.. A'jaazun (n. plu.): Trunks.

data.meanings: To be present, present at, stand in presence of, hurt, be at hand.
data.sentence: The word مُحْضَرُونَ comes from the root ح ض ر and is associated with the meanings: To be present, present at, stand in presence of, hurt, be at hand.

data.meanings: he walked or went along, to strive/exert/labour/work, go quickly, effort, endeavour, hasten/act/run, be active, diligent, age of running or work and assist (child).
data.sentence: The word يَسْعَوْنَ comes from the root س ع ي and is associated with the meanings: he walked or went along, to strive/exert/labour/work, go quickly, effort, endeavour, hasten/act/run, be active, diligent, age of running or work and assist (child).
